titles.title: Formula Shortage Reporting Act of 2022
Formula Shortage Reporting Act of 2022
To authorize the Food and Drug Administration to require manufacturers of infant formula to warn about a discontinuance or interruption in the production of infant formula, and for other purposes.

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on Energy and Commerce.

bill.summary:
Formula Shortage Reporting Act of 2022
This bill requires manufacturers of infant formula to notify the Food and Drug Administration (FDA) at least 72 hours in advance of a manufacturing interruption or product discontinuance that is expected to meaningfully disrupt the product's supply. The FDA must post such information on its website and notify health care providers.
